pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six traveled by appointment with nuns.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.3_0: People then complained and criticized those nuns,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.4_0: “Just as we walk about with our wives, so these Sakyan ascetics walk about by appointment with nuns.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.5_0: The monks heard those people complaining,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.6_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.7_0: “How can the monks from the group of six travel by appointment with nuns?” ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.8_0: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.12_0: who gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.13_0: “Monks, I allow you to travel by appointment with a nun if it’s a risky and dangerous road that should be traveled with a group.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.14_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.15.1_0: ‘If a monk travels by appointment with a nun, even just to the next village, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.16_0: This is the appropriate occasion: the road is considered risky and dangerous and should be traveled with a group.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.1_0: On one occasion a number of monks and nuns were traveling from Sāketa to Sāvatthī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.2_0: The nuns said to the monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.4_0: “Sisters, it’s not allowable for us to travel by appointment with nuns.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.5_0: You go first, or we will.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.6_0: “Venerables, I have served the best of men.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.8_0: But because they were walking along by those nuns, they were robbed and raped by bandits.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.9_0: When they arrived at Sāvatthī they told the nuns there what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.1_0: If there is an appointment, and he perceives that there is, and he travels with a nun, even just to the next village, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.2_0: If there is an appointment, but he is unsure of it, and he travels with a nun, even just to the next village, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.3_0: If there is an appointment, but he perceives that there is not, and he travels with a nun, even just to the next village, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.7_0: If there is no appointment, and he perceives that there is not, there is no offense.
